metadata.title: CVE-2018-0500 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Curl_smtp_escape_eob in lib/smtp.c in curl 7.54.1 to and including curl7.60.0 has a heap-based buffer overflow that might be exploitable by anattacker who can control the data that curl transmits over SMTP withcertain settings (i.e., use of a nonstandard --limit-rate argument orCURLOPT_BUFFERSIZE value).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-0500` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.8
libcurl3 - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.8
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.8
libcurl3-nss - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: curl package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.47.0-1ubuntu2.8').
